New Records: The Thunder are riding a franchise-record 14-game winning streak.
Pre-Game Insights: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander expressed extra motivation for the game against the Celtics, stating 'Absolutely. They won and we’re trying to win.'
The Thunder have trailed each of the last three games by at least 12 points before coming back to win, including overcoming a 14-point deficit in Friday’s 117-107 home win over the Knicks.
Oklahoma City is 10-0 against the Eastern Conference, though it fell to Milwaukee in the NBA Cup final that doesn’t count in the regular-season standings.
The Celtics enter Sunday’s game on a three-game winning streak, with the last two wins coming at the start of a four-game road trip.
Boston’s Kristaps Porzingis mentioned a team meeting before the trip to discuss improvements and better performance.
During their winning streak, the Celtics are shooting 51.6 percent from the floor and have posted a 133.6 offensive rating and a 103.3 defensive rating, both best in the NBA over that span.
Celtics star Jayson Tatum emphasized the team's effort to get back to their identity on both ends of the floor.
Oklahoma City has the NBA’s best defense, with a 102.9 defensive rating.
During the Thunder’s winning streak, Gilgeous-Alexander is averaging 32.7 points, 5.2 assists, 5.2 rebounds, 2.3 steals, and 1.2 blocks.
Kristaps Porzingis acknowledged the challenge of facing Gilgeous-Alexander and noted the support he receives from his teammates.
Gilgeous-Alexander highlighted the depth and versatility of the Thunder team, emphasizing their collective desire to win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Porzingis returned Friday after missing four games with a left ankle sprain.

Boston star Jaylen Brown has missed the last two games with a shoulder strain while Al Horford is expected to return Sunday after missing Friday’s win due to rest on the second night of a back-to-back.
